Topic.Title: Many will claim in befuttlememt, "but only 2% of the entire float iz short!"

Message.Msg: "My calculations are different taking into account available shares, institutional and board holdings about 46M share float. With 6M short that is about 14% short. Not 51%" You idiot! More than 2 standard deviationz out comprise volume at 3 mil or less every day. The institutionz have and will continue to tie up the float 'for an extended period of time'. The calculation of REAL daily short interest iz very simple : go to the FINRA daily short report , look up the NASDAQ, which handlez the bulk of bircoin tradez, and divide the short traded sharez into the total number of daily sharez traded on that exchange. sybil haz been doing this since june and haz never calculated anything less then 30% daily short interest. sometimez the bandwaggon gets so wxcited to lose their ars that it clocks in north of 70% of all sharez traded for that day. Yesterday waz a kool 50%.... This doesnt even consider the cabbage that the banks make of selling expensive crackhead optionz to etfs and retail buyerz of this garbage. Theze stox aint crashing until the banks have to 'generate cash' , or until the shorts and crackheadz throw in the towel and give up. While Sybil thought bernanke would throw in the qe towel 1st, sybs haz revised that to be that shorts will be destroyed 1st based on last fed meeting. Its very simple, please dont make it hard - you may hurt yourself.

Topic.Title: too much bullish on this board

Message.Msg: I should clarify lest Nem say it is all QE again. The large institutional longs managing the (soon to be unwillingly) invested public's retirement accounts are NOT getting QE funds -- those are going to TBTF/POMO/BB institutions. But, they are happily playing along because they skim more $ from higher (temporary) AUM, even though their clients whose money they are managing, supposedly with aligned interests, end up with less. WS has become one giant skimming operation, even for the supposed institutional long "investors".

Topic.Title: too much bullish on this board

Message.Msg: Cantillon effect. He who gets the money first gets the value. 401K operators aren't getting the benefit. No, they perpetuate this ponzi out of a classic agency problem, putting their own comp ahead of the shareholders as these bubble cycles allow them to extract greater share of total value. Someday, there will be interesting questions asked about fiduciary responsibility, but that is for the lawyers to figure out.

Topic.Title: too much bullish on this board

Message.Msg: Said differently, if the TBTF/POMO banks decide to shift where they direct the daily flow/infinite leverage, they can/will move all these assets wherever they want to. Their advanatage. The benefit to 401Ks will be fleeting and value will accrue to the "house" having infinite leverage. These bubbles will be popped when T BTBTF/POMO has finished rotating.

Topic.Title: The true looming fight...

Message.Msg: i unigged u for a minute because the chyt is so boring. okay, i will try to explain it in very simple terms. and since both of u are landlords u should understand me :) lets say Tech owns several pieces of rentals that he bought very long ago and his debt service cost basis is ridiculously low. he then charges certain slightly below market rent rates to keep his buildings 100% full without any vacancies. he used to buy them earlier and now he controls the rent in the neighborhood. currently, however, becuase of ben/fed/ws/interest rates he can't buy anything as prices are total mismatch. but u like low rates and as creative guy all u care is monthly payment, so u buy now and u have to charge a lot just to have positive cash flow. suddenly u learned previous owner gave free rent in order to keep SGI higher. so u lose a little and u pretend u are okay. Tech... he knows u are screwed and he waits for u to get whacked as he considers u transitional owner. u are being tortured by him and his ability to always be ahead of u. then boom, and your rate resets higher and u are starting to default. eventually Tech comes in and takes the piece out of your hands ending your misery. same with amazon/yelp/lnkd/etc etc. those who entered low then used fed/ben to push it higher and started enjoying weekly coupons at very high strikes, but still with lower risk strikes. and they profit at the rate of 5% a week. how can u make them give it up? no one can unless with the gun. so the guy with 20% annual roi or more will always kill u in the real biz even u can have your stinking break even or tax write off via depreciation. eventually u will be out
